verses.verse: (Zophar Speaks: Job’s Guilt Deserves Punishment) Then Zophar the Naamathite answered:
(Job 8.2) “Should a multitude of words go unanswered, and should one full of talk be vindicated?
(Job 17.2; 21.3; Jas 3.5) Should your babble put others to silence, and when you mock, shall no one shame you?
(Job 6.14; 10.7) For you say, ‘My conduct (Gk: Heb teaching) is pure, and I am clean in God’s (Heb your) sight.’
But O that God would speak and open his lips to you
(Ezra 9.13; Job 28.21) and that he would tell you the secrets of wisdom! For wisdom is many-sided. (Meaning of Heb uncertain) Know then that God exacts of you less than your guilt deserves.
(Eccl 3.11; Rom 11.33) “Can you find out the deep things of God? Can you find out the limit of the Almighty? (Traditional rendering of Heb Shaddai)
(Job 17.16; 22.12) It is higher than heaven (Heb The heights of heaven) —what can you do? Deeper than Sheol—what can you know?
Its measure is longer than the earth and broader than the sea.
(Job 9.12; Rev 3.7) If he passes through and imprisons and assembles for judgment, who can hinder him?
(Job 34.21-25; Ps 10.14) For he knows those who are worthless; when he sees iniquity, will he not consider it?
But the stupid will get understanding when a wild ass is born human. (Meaning of Heb uncertain)
(Ps 78.8; 88.9) “If you direct your heart rightly, you will stretch out your hands toward him.
(Job 22.23; Ps 101.3) If iniquity is in your hand, put it far away, and do not let wickedness reside in your tents.
(Ps 27.3; 1 Jn 3.21) Surely then you will lift up your face without blemish; you will be secure and will not fear.
(Isa 65.16) You will forget your misery; you will remember it as waters that have passed away.
(Ps 37.6; 112.4; Isa 58.8, 10) And your life will be brighter than the noonday; its darkness will be like the morning.
(Ps 3.5; Prov 3.24) And you will have confidence because there is hope; you will be protected (Or you will look around) and take your rest in safety.
You will lie down, and no one will make you afraid; many will entreat your favor.
(Deut 28.65; Jer 15.9) But the eyes of the wicked will fail; all way of escape will be lost to them, and their hope is to breathe their last.”
